title: Ticket #5284: Test more networking configurations.
description: We have the ability to append arbitrary configuration knobbage to each test's config file, and we're doing this to do a quick IPv6 smoke-test one one platform per commit. We should write a script that takes a git hash or tag and submits build, and then a whole lot of test( run)s of it, one for each networking config of interest. (w/ a public IPv6 primary address, without using 127.0.0.1, using ::1, etc? TJ had the thoughts.) Then should run this script at least once per release candidate but maybe also nightly.
